DOC.brief_summary: This study compare efficacy medial branch block ( MBB ) vs. paravertebral deep intramuscular ( PDI ) injection pain relief chronic low back pain . Based randomization first intervention session , one side receive MBB side take PDI second session pattern revers .
DOC.brief_title: Medial Branch Block vs Para-spinal Muscle Injection Patients With Non-specific Chronic Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Pain relief follow medial branch block ( MBB ) might due facet joint desensitization and/or myofascial trigger point ' desensitization . Patients randomize two group . The first group receive MBB one side paravertebral deep intramuscular ( PDI ) injection side back . Next week pattern injection reverse side receive MBB take PDI injection PDI side take MBB . Second group take intervention reverse order .
DOC.criteria: CLBP nonmalignant origin fulfil follow criterion : Pain last least three month Pain leave right side back Pain L2 vertebral body Lumbar spine CT scan MRI do last 2 year Average visual analogue scale ( VAS ) pain â‰¥4/10 side last week Cognitive physical ability provide inform consent English French Neurologic sign symptom suggest nerve root involvement Strictly unilateral Low Back Pain ( LBP ) CT scan MRI finding suggestive pain etiology beyond degenerative spine disease Vascular malformation Tumor Infection Fractures DISH ( Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis ) Patients receive injection type acupuncture therapy low back last 3 month Prior spine surgery Local systemic infection Bleeding disorder use anticoagulation medication lowdose aspirin Known allergy amid local anesthetic Active insurance claim ( CSST , SAAQ ) Uncontrolled psychiatric condition
